Yi-Lin (Pascal) Tuan

PhD candidate at UCSB.

ytuan at ucsb.edu

My research interest is the inner and outer interpretability of deep learning models, where inner refers to the underlying theory for training the models and outer refers to unveiling the models’ reason in producing the outputs. Along this line, my works include:

  • Inner and Outer interpretability in Dialogue Generation
  • Science and Machine Learning
  • Deep Reinforcement Learning and Generative Adversarial Nets

I’m currently a Computer Science PhD candidate at University of California, Santa Barbara (UCSB), working with professor William Yang Wang. Before that, I received BS degree in Electrical Engineering from National Taiwan University, where I worked with professor Lin-shan Lee on speech processing, professor Hung-yi Lee on generative adversarial nets and reinforcement learning, professor Yun-Nung Chen on Conversational AI. I have interned at Meta (Facebook) AI at 2023 (host by Dan Bikel), 2022 (host by Wenhan Xiong and Yashar Mehdad) and 2020 (host by Ahmed El-Kishky and Paco Guzmán), and Amazon Alexa AI (host by Sajjad Beygi and Marriam Fazel-Zarandi) at 2021.

More details of me are in my CV. Feel free to contact me via email.

Oct 9, 2023 Our paper Flexible Attention-Based Multi-Policy Fusion for Efficient Deep Reinforcement Learning is accepted to NeurIPS2023! Stay tune for our camera ready version and code!

May 2, 2023 Our paper CausalDialogue: Modeling Utterance-level Causality in Conversations is accepted to ACL-Findings 2023! Our camera ready version and code have been public!
Feb 1, 2023 FETA benchmark will be a shared task at the ACL ‘23 workshop NLP for ConvAI!
Dec 1, 2022 SEScore received the Best Unsupervised Text Generation metric at WMT22 shared task!
